title: The aircraft has three fuel tanks. A flexible fuselage fuel …
caption_en: The aircraft has three fuel tanks. A flexible fuselage fuel tank is located behind the rear pressure butkhead. This holds kgs of usable fuel. Each wing has an integral tank. Each wing tank holds kgs of usable fuel. The total usable fuel is approximately Kgs. pop A a ml sm aa ET wri

title: In the wing tanks, internal web-type ribs, known as baffle p…
caption_en: In the wing tanks, internal web-type ribs, known as baffle plates, separate the tank into compartments. They serve to limit fuel surging in the tanks when the aircraft deviates from straight and level flight. a A a ml sm am ET wri

title: This is normally the lowest part of the tank and fuel for th…
caption_en: This is normally the lowest part of the tank and fuel for the engine is supplied from the collector tank. Fuel is able to flow from the outer compartments toward the collector tank through one-way check valves at the bottom of the baffie plates. Openings at the top of the baffle plates allow fuel to flow either towards the inboard or outboard ends of the tank. a A a ml sm am ET wri

title: Drains for the fuel system are shown here for information. T…
caption_en: Drains for the fuel system are shown here for information. The wing sump drains are accessible without the need to open access panels. ew IN am ET wri
